meanings.definition: Situated in front of or on the anterior side of an axis or midline.
meanings.sent1: The preaxial fin of the fish helps it steer in the water.
meanings.sent2: The thumb is a preaxial digit on the human hand.
meanings.sent3: The preaxial position of the mailbox made it easier for the mail carrier to deliver letters.
meanings.sent4: Her preaxial leadership style always put the team's needs first.
meanings.sent5: The preaxial view from the top of the mountain was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: Located on the side of the body that is closer to the front or head.
meanings.sent1: The preaxial muscles in the arm help with lifting objects.
meanings.sent2: The preaxial part of the leg is important for balance.
meanings.sent3: The preaxial placement of the dessert on the table tempted everyone.
meanings.sent4: His preaxial approach to problem-solving always yielded quick solutions.
meanings.sent5: The preaxial features of the car made it look sleek and modern.
